A Reuters poll ahead of the release showed the consensus among economists was for headline inflation for the month to come in at 2.3 per cent, according to LSEG Data & Analytics. That would mark a slight in

articles.title: Do Ottawa council challenges to Ontario legislation work?
articles.description: The city's opposition to the ban on traffic cameras and Bill 60 has reverberated at Queen’s Park, local MPPs say, even as the bills sailed through the legislature.

articles.title: Young Canadians tell of their generations’ challenges and hopes
articles.description: The Canadian Press has been speaking with young people across the country about challenges facing their generation — and ways they continue to find joy. ‘YOU’RE HUMAN AND YOU FEEL THINGS’ Violet Rode, an 18-year-old theatre student at Dawson College in Montreal, says she watches th

articles.description: The leak came as Prime Minister Mark Carney considers whether to purchase the Gripen or F-35.

articles.title: How did Canada’s young people become its unhappiest generation?
articles.description: VANCOUVER — As a teen growing up in Toronto, Bhavik Sharma imagined what life would look like at 25. He and his high school friends would be starting families. articles.title: Merriam-Webster’s 2025 word of the year is ‘slop’
articles.description: Creepy, zany and demonstrably fake content is often called “slop.” The word’s proliferation online, in part thanks to the widespread availability of generative artificial intelligence, landed it Merriam-Webster’s 2025 word of the year. “It’s such an illustrative word,” said Greg Ba
